title: Khabib Nurmagomedov doesn't even have a fight scheduled but is keeping fit by swimming against the tide in a cold river in Dagestan
text:
Khabib Nurmagomedov is seen on an Instagram video swimming against the tide in a cold river in Dagestan, Russia.

Nurmagomedov doesn't even have a fight lined up but is taking extraordinary measures to keep fit and stay sharp.

Nurmagomedov last fought in September, defeating Dustin Poirier by third round submission in a defense of his UFC lightweight championship.

Watch the video below.

Khabib Nurmagomedov doesn't even have a fight scheduled but he's keeping fit by swimming against the tide in a cold river in Dagestan, Russia.

Nurmagomedov, the UFC's reigning lightweight champion, defended his title at the UFC 242 show in Abu Dhabi in September, defeating Dustin Poirier in the third round with a rear-naked choke.

He has no opponent lined up to fight next, but is expected to return to the Octagon in March or April next year, potentially against number one contender Tony Ferguson.

Read more: An Irish boxer is challenging Conor McGregor to 'stay sober' long enough so they can end their war of words and fight for a world title

Even though Nurmagomedov has no fight to prepare for, he is still busy training and a video has been posted on Instagram that shows him staying sharp in the Kizilyurt region of Dagestan, likely in the Sulak river that drains the mountainous water into the Caspian sea.

Watch the video here:

Всем течениям на зло! 😄 Hard work and dedication from champ 🥶 @khabib_nurmagomedov Today was very cold, he doesn’t care. Water was very cold I tried to put my feet and almost freeze my a$$ off😄 Tony you’re in trouble! A post shared by @ kingfarruh on Oct 13, 2019 at 9:27am PDT Oct 13, 2019 at 9:27am PDT

The video was posted by Nurmagomedov's friend known as King Farruh on Instagram, who shares a lot of photos of the fighter.

Read more: Khabib Nurmagomedov is continuing to shun Conor McGregor and instead wants to fight Tony Ferguson in front of 70,000 Russians

"Today was very cold, he doesn't care," a caption on the video read. "Water was very cold. I tried to put my feet and almost freeze my ass off."

In a nod to Nurmagomedov's probable opponent Ferguson, King Farruh added: "Tony, you're in trouble!"
description: The reigning UFC lightweight champion, renowned for wrestling bears, is once again going to extraordinary lengths to keep fit.
